post_title: India's election overshadowed by the rise of online misinformation
title: "India's 2023 Elections: Misinformation Rampant, Government & Big Tech Respond"
post_content:
Title: The Epidemic of Misinformation in India's Elections: A Deep Dive into its Impact and Prevalence

Introduction

As India embarks on the world's largest democratic exercise, the 2023 general election, the electoral process is plagued by an insidious threat: misinformation. With more than 830 million internet users and a vast user base for social media platforms, India is particularly vulnerable to the dissemination of false information. This article explores the escalating issue of misinformation in Indian elections, its consequences, and the efforts being made to combat it.

The Misinformation Crisis: A Deadly Consequence of Internet Penetration

The rapid expansion of internet access in India has led to a concurrent rise in misinformation and disinformation. According to the World Economic Forum, India ranks at the highest risk for misinformation and disinformation, exacerbated by the increasing use of artificial intelligence and deepfakes. The consequences of misinformation extend beyond election fairness, with instances of violence on the ground and increased hatred towards minorities.

The Deliberate Creation of Misinformation and the Challenges for Fact-Checkers

Pratik Sinha, co-founder of the Indian non-profit fact-checking website Alt News, has observed a worrying trend: the deliberate creation of misinformation to polarize society. The country's vast linguistic and cultural diversity complicates the efforts of fact-checkers, who strive to review and filter out misleading content. As Angie Drobnic Holan, director of the International Fact-Checking Network, notes, "When you have a lot of misinformation, you have a lot of need for fact-checking, and things that make the Indian environment more complex are the many languages of India."

The Government's Response and the Role of Big Tech

The Indian government has attempted to address the misinformation crisis by updating its IT intermediary rules in 2022, requiring social media companies to remove misleading content within 72 hours of being reported. However, enforcement remains weak, and digital advocacy groups like the Internet Freedom Foundation have reported selective enforcement.

Tech giants like Google and Meta have announced initiatives to limit misleading content on their platforms during Indian elections, but their efforts have been criticized for lacking significant product-related
meta_desc: Meta Description: Join forces to combat election manipulation! Civil societies, governments, & tech companies must collaborate to enforce IT rules, innovate detection methods, and empower voters with accurate info. IndiaElections Misinformation

post_title: A coffee roastery in Finland has launched an AI-generated blend. The results were surprising
title: AI Crafts Surprising Coffee Blend at Finnish Roastery: Kaffa's AI-conic Experience
post_content:
Title: A Blend of Tradition and Innovation: The AI-conic Coffee by Kaffa Roastery

In the heart of Finland, a country known for its strong coffee culture and passion for technology, an artisan roastery has embarked on a unique journey to integrate artificial intelligence into the traditional process of coffee roasting. Kaffa Roastery, in collaboration with local AI consultancy Elev, has introduced the "AI-conic" blend, a coffee selection developed by AI with an aim to revolutionize the sector and ease the workload associated with manual labor.

Finland, a nation of 5.6 million, proudly holds the title for the highest coffee consumption per capita, with an annual average of 12 kilograms, according to the International Coffee Organization. Thus, it is only fitting that the AI-conic blend made its debut in this Nordic country. The result of a joint project between Kaffa and Elev, the AI-conic blend is a meticulously crafted mixture of four types of beans, dominated by the velvety Fazenda Pinhal from Brazil.

Elev's AI, similar to models like ChatGPT and Copilot, was tasked with creating a blend that would appeal to coffee enthusiasts, challenging conventional flavor combinations. The process involved providing the AI with detailed descriptions of Kaffa's coffee types and their flavors, instructing it to develop a new and exciting blend. The AI selected beans from Brazil, Colombia, Ethiopia, and Guatemala, and even created the coffee package label and a distinct taste description: "AI-conic is a well-balanced blend of sweetness and ripe fruit."

Svante Hampf, Kaffa Roastery's founder and managing director, expressed his surprise at the AI's choice of using four different types of coffee beans, rather than the usual two or three. However, after the first test roasting and blind testing, Kaffa's coffee experts agreed that the tech-assisted blend was flawless, requiring no human adjustments.

Antti Merilehto, Elev's spokesman, lauded the AI-conic blend as a testament to AI's potential in introducing new perspectives to seasoned professionals and providing coffee lovers with novel taste experiences. Kaffa Roastery views this trial as an
meta_desc: Experience the future of coffee with our AI-generated "AI-conic" blend! Discover bold, balanced flavors from Brazil, Colombia, Ethiopia, & Guatemala. Taste the innovation today!

post_title: Women in AI: Allison Cohen on building responsible AI projects
title: Allison Cohen's Mission: Responsible AI & Gender Equality
post_content:
Title: Spotlight on Allison Cohen: Pioneering Socially Beneficial AI Projects

Introduction

Among the unsung heroes contributing significantly to the AI revolution, there exists a group of extraordinary women whose contributions often go overlooked. To rectify this situation, TechCrunch has initiated a series of interviews featuring prominent female figures who've left indelible marks in the field of artificial intelligence. This article highlights the achievements of Allison Cohen, Senior Applied AI Project Manager at Mila, a renowned research institute based in Quebec, Canada. With her diverse background spanning AI, policy, and linguistics, Cohen leads socially impactful AI initiatives collaboratively with researchers, social scientists, and external partners. In this interview, she shares insights gleaned from her impressive career thus far.

Breaking Into AI: A Nontraditional Pathway

Cohen discovered AI during her pursuit of a Master's degree in Global Affairs at the University of Toronto. Initially drawn to its potential to transform industries and societies, she soon realized the importance of understanding AI ethics and governance to address pressing societal concerns better. Her unique perspective came to light through an unexpected opportunityâ€”an essay-writing contest where she delved into the relationship between psychedelic drugs and AI's role in future labor markets. Winning the competition opened doors for her to engage further in AI discussions and eventually embark upon a successful career path in the field.

Managing Challenges: Bias Detection Tool

As part of her extensive portfolio, Cohen oversaw a groundbreaking initiative involving the creation of a dataset aimed at identifying subtle and explicit expressions of bias against women in natural language contexts. Through effective collaboration among NLP experts, linguists, and gender studies scholars, they successfully built a robust dataset used to develop an innovative AI application. By facilitating cross-discipline communication, Cohen demonstrated the immense value brought forth by combining longstanding methodologies from social sciences with modern advances in computer science. Moreover, her pioneering efforts sparked similar undertakings worldwide, including an adaptation led by AI Sweden tailored specifically to capture Swedes' unique expressions of misogyny.

Navigating Gender Dynamics in AI & Technology Industries

Despite progress towards greater inclusivity, Cohen acknowledges persistent gender disparities present in both technology and AI sectors. Adopting "Feminist Standpoint Theory" principles, she emphasizes the significance of integrating various viewpoints originating from underrepresented populations to foster equitable advancements. By failing to incorporate women in decision-making processes, the AI sector risks perpetuating existing imbalances beyond its confines, ultimately limiting innovation. Thus, fostering diversity remains paramount in addressing complex problems faced by society today.

Conclusion

Allison Cohen embodies resilience and determination in navigating the traditionally male-dominated fields of AI and technology. Leveraging her distinct skill set acquired through education and experience, she champions responsible AI implementation while advocating for broader representation within the industry. Amidst accelerated technological growth, stories like Cohen's serve as powerful reminders of the need for increased diversity and inclusion in shaping tomorrow's digital landscape.
meta_desc:
"Unleashing Ethical AI: Discover how Allison Cohen champions Responsible AI projects, tackling gender bias in technology."

Meta Description: Join us as we explore Allison Cohen's mission to foster responsible AI development, addressing critical issues like gender bias in tech through innovative solutions and cross-disciplinary collaboration.

post_title: Microsoft's AI tool can turn photos into realistic videos of people talking and singing
title: Title: Microsoft's VASA-1: Realistic Talking Faces from Photos & Audio, Ethical Concerns
post_content:
Title: Unmasking the Potential of Microsoft Research Asia's New AI Tool, VASA-1

Introduction:
In a world where artificial intelligence (AI) continues to push boundaries, Microsoft Research Asia recently introduced an experimental AI tool named VASA-1. This remarkable innovation brings static images and audio files together, creating astonishingly realistic talking faces in real-time. With the capability to generate facial expressions, head movements, and synchronized lip movements corresponding to speech or songs, VASA-1 demonstrates impressive results, raising both excitement and concerns about its implications.

Understanding VASA-1's Capabilities and Limitations:
VASA-1's outputs display uncanny authenticity, making it possible to deceive viewers into believing they are witnessing genuine video footage. However, scrutiny reveals minor imperfections in synchronization between the generated lip and head movements. Despite these shortcomings, there remains significant potential for abuseâ€”namely, generating deepfake videos featuring actual individuals without consent. Aware of such dangers, the research team is holding back on releasing public demos, APIs, or further implementation details until stringent regulation policies ensure responsible use.

Exploring Beneficial Applications of VASA-1:
Despite ethical apprehension surrounding VASA-1, numerous positive applications emerge when utilized ethically. These include enhancing educational opportunities by enabling customized teaching tools, improving accessibility through avatars capable of facilitating communication for those facing challenges, offering comfort via AI companions, and supporting therapy sessions involving virtual characters.

Training and Versatility:
Based on the VoxCeleb2 dataset containing over a million soundbites from 6,112 famous figures sourced from YouTube videos, VASA-1 exhibits adaptable capabilities. Impressively, beyond functioning optimally with real human subjects, the system successfully applies to iconic art pieces like the Mona Lisa. Combined with Anne Hathaway's memorable interpretation of Lil Wayne's Paparazzi, this example showcases VASA-1's versatile application range.

Conclusion:
Artificial Intelligence advancements bring incredible innovations alongside critical considerations regarding privacy, security, and ethical conduct. Microsoft Research Asia's novel AI tool, VASA-1, provides us another opportunity to reflect on our relationship with emerging technologies while marveling at the possibilities created by combining different media types seamlessly. By addressing ethical concerns and implementing robust regulatory measures, society will continue benefiting significantly from AI developments, fostering growth across education, entertainment, healthcare, and interpersonal connection.
meta_desc: Create lifelike videos of people talking & singing with Microsoft's new AI tool, VASA-1. Explore beneficial applications in education, accessibility, and therapy. Act now! VASA1 AIrevolution

Title: Unmasking the Potential of Microsoft Research Asia's New AI Tool, VASA-1

Introduction:
In the ever-evolving realm of artificial intelligence (AI), Microsoft Research Asia has unveiled an innovative AI tool called VASA-1. This groundbreaking technology merges still images and audio clips to produce strikingly realistic talking heads in real-time. Featuring nuanced facial expressions, head movements, and synchronized lip syncing that correspond to spoken words or song lyrics, VASA-1 delivers impressive outcomes while sparking discussions about its ramifications.

Understanding VASA-1's Capabilities and Limitations:
Although VASA-1 generates highly convincing visuals, closer examination reveals occasional discrepancies in the coordination between lip movement and head motion. Nevertheless, considerable potential exists for misuse, particularly concerning deepfake videos featuring recognizable individuals without their permission. Recognizing these risks, the research team is cautious about disseminating public demos, APIs, or additional implementation specifics until stringent regulations guarantee responsible usage.

Exploring Beneficial Applications of VASA-1:
While ethical qualms surround VASA-1, many constructive uses arise when employed responsibly. Such benefits encompass expanding educational resources with tailored learning instruments, bolstering accessibility via communicative avatars for those confronted with barriers, furnishing solace through AI-powered companions, and augmenting therapeutic engagements involving digital personas.

Training and Versatility:
Harnessing the extensive VoxCeleb2 dataset comprising more than one million excerpts from 6,112 renowned personalities derived from YouTube recordings, VASA-1 proves adept at handling diverse scenarios. Remarkably, apart from excelling with genuine human subjects, the platform effectively accommodates eminent artwork like the Mona Lisa. Coupled with Anne Hathaway's captivating portrayal of Lil Wayne's "Paparazzi," this instance underscores VASA-1's vast applicability spectrum.

Conclusion:
As AI progress propels humanity toward unprecedented achievements, crucial questions surface regarding data protection, safety, and moral principles. Microsoft Research Asia's pioneering AI tool, VASA-1, offers yet another occasion to ponder our evolving rapport with burgeoning technologies. Addressing ethical issues and instituting rigorous oversight mechanisms will enable society to harness AI advances' myriad advantages, cultivating advancement across instruction, amusement, health care, and social connections.

post_title: Fintech startup Ramp sees 32% bump in valuation, Mercury expands into consumer banking
title: Fintech News: Ramp's Soaring Valuation & Mercury's Consumer Banking Move
post_content:
Title: The Latest in Fintech: Ramp's Valuation Surge, Mercury's Personal Banking Venture, and Global Funding Rounds

Welcome to this weekâ€™s fintech roundup, where we delve into the most significant developments and intriguing stories in the financial technology sector. Letâ€™s dive in.

The Big Story

Ramp, a spend management startup, has recently secured $150 million in a funding round led by Khosla Ventures and Founders Fund, valuing the company at $7.65 billion. This valuation represents a 31.9% increase from its previous funding round in August 2023. Despite a challenging market, Ramp continues to grow and distinguish itself through AI-driven solutions and a commitment to serving its customers.

Analysis of the Week

Mercury, a business banking platform serving more than 100,000 businesses, is expanding into the consumer banking space. CEO and co-founder Immad Akhund revealed that Mercury aims to convert its existing business clients into personal banking customers, rather than targeting the general public. This move follows a similar pivot by Onyx Private from B2C to B2B. While some industry experts argue that business and personal banking are different beasts, Mercury has a head start with its established client base.

Dollars and Cents

Finmid, a Berlin-based embedded fintech startup, has raised $24.7 million in a Series A round, bringing its valuation to $107 million. The company plans to use the funds to further develop its product and enter new markets.

Pula, a Kenyan insurtech focusing on agricultural insurance for small-holder farmers, has secured $20 million in Series B funding. Since its inception in 2015, Pula has supported over 15.4 million farmers in Africa, Asia, and Latin America and aims to expand its services to more markets.

Midas, a Turkish fintech enabling investment in U.S. and Turkish equities, has raised $45 million in a funding round led by Portage of Canada.

Additionally, rumors suggest that HR/fintech startup Rippling is raising $200 million, with another $670 million worth of shares being sold by existing stockholders.

post_title: This Week in AI: When 'open source' isn't so open
title:
Title: Debating 'Open Source' AI: Meta's Llama 3 & Accessibility Challenges

Introduction

Stay updated on AI industry developments, including Meta's Llama 3 models and the true meaning of 'open source' AI.

Key Points:
- Meta's Llama 3 models are less accessible than claimed, despite being 'open sourced.'
- A study by Carnegie Mellon, AI Now Institute, and Signal Foundation reveals AI models' limitations.
- Misuse of 'open source' by large tech firms hinders progress and democratization of AI.

Additional Stories:
- Meta AI chatbot upgraded with Llama 3 and new features.
- AI-generated porn raises ethical concerns and policy questions.
post_content:
Title: The State of 'Open Source' AI: A Closer Look at Accessibility and Ownership

Introduction

Staying current with the ever-evolving AI industry can be challenging. This roundup focuses on recent news and developments in the world of machine learning, including notable research and events. We delve into Meta's latest release of its Llama series of generative AI models, Llama 3 8B and Llama 3 70B, and examine the concept of 'open source' AI.

The Llama 3 Models: Open Source or Not?

Meta recently unveiled the Llama 3 models, which are capable of analyzing and generating text. The company claims these models are 'open sourced,' but strict licensing restrictions make them less accessible than claimed. The term 'open source' is often used loosely in the AI community, and Meta's approach has raised questions about the true meaning and implications of open source AI.

A Closer Look at AI and Open Source

Many AI models, including Meta's Llama series, are not genuinely open source, according to a study co-authored by researchers at Carnegie Mellon, AI Now Institute, and Signal Foundation. While these models are branded as open source, they often come with restrictions and conditions that limit their accessibility and usability.

The study highlights several key issues:

1. Data required to train AI models is kept secret, limiting reproducibility.
2. The immense compute power needed to run AI models is beyond the reach of many developers.
3. Fine-tuning AI models requires significant labor, which is often prohibitively expensive.

The Harm in Misusing 'Open Source'

When large tech companies like Meta release AI models under the guise of open source, they reap most of the benefits, while the broader community sees limited gains. Instead of democratizing AI, these projects tend to consolidate and expand centralized power, ultimately hindering progress in the field.

Other Noteworthy AI Stories

1. Meta upgrades its chatbot: Meta upgraded Meta AI, its AI chatbot, with a Llama 3-powered backend, and introduced new features such as faster image generation and access to web search results.
2. AI-generated porn: The Overs

post_title: Boston Dynamics unveils a new robot, controversy over MKBHD, and layoffs at Tesla
title: Tech Updates: Musk's X Fee, Change Healthcare Breach, AirChat
post_content:
Welcome to This Week in Review, where we summarize the most interesting developments in technology that you might have missed during the past seven days. Let's dive right in!

Elon Musk's Plans for X

Elon Musk, CEO of SpaceX, Tesla, and Neuralink, announced plans to charge new users a small fee to post on X, his social media platform. According to Musk, the goal is to combat bots and spam on the site. With this change, X aims to become a premium experience for serious users, providing them with valuable interactions while reducing noise.

Change Healthcare Data Breach

An extortion group leaked sensitive information belonging to millions of American patients following a ransomware attack on Change Healthcare in February. Although the company refused to pay the ransom demand, hackers still managed to publish part of the stolen data online. Change Healthcare maintains that only a limited amount of personal data was exposed and emphasizes that no medical records or Social Security numbers were affected. Nevertheless, those impacted may want to monitor their accounts closely for suspicious activity.

Tesla Adjusts Prices and FSD Package Cost

In response to tightening margins amidst fierce competition in the EV market, Tesla made significant changes to its pricing strategy. The company removed inventory price discounts and lowered the monthly cost of its Full Self-Driving (FSD) package to $99 in the USâ€”a substantial decrease from the previous rate of $199. These moves reflect Tesla's efforts to streamline its sales process and remain competitive in the rapidly growing EV industry.

Startups Eye Opportunities in Mars Sample Return Mission

NASA's recent decision to turn its $11 billion Mars sample return mission into a commercial endeavor has sparked excitement among various space startups. Companies such as Lockheed Martin and Blue Origin stand to benefit significantly from this shift, potentially gaining access to valuable resources and partnership opportunities. However, concerns regarding safety, intellectual property rights, and potential conflicts of interest must be addressed before these collaborations can proceed.

Waymo Robotaxis Cause Road Blockages

Rebecca reported that six Waymo robotaxis halted traffic moving onto an on-ramp in San Francisco on Tuesday, blocking the path for multiple cars trying to enter the highway. While this isn't the first instance of Waymo vehicles obstructing traffic, it marks the first occurrence involving a freeway. Such incidents raise questions about the reliability and coordination capabilities of autonomous vehicle systems.

Google Cloud Bets Big on Generative AI

At Google's Cloud Next conference, the tech giant revealed numerous investments aimed at advancing generative artificial intelligence technologies. Among these initiatives is Vertex AI, a suite of tools designed to help developers build, deploy, and manage large language models. Additionally, Google introduced Imagen, an image generation model capable of creating highly realistic images based on simple text prompts.

Experts Question Readiness of Generative AI in Healthcare

Despite rapid advancements in generative AI, many experts argue that the technology remains unprepared for widespread adoption in healthcare settings. Critics cite concerns related to data privacy, security risks, and insufficient validation methods as primary reasons why AI applications should undergo rigorous testing before deployment in clinical environments.

Introducing AirChat â€“ Voice Communication App

Former AngelList founder Naval Ravikant and ex-Tinder executive Brian Norgard recently launched Airchat, an innovative communication app focused solely on voice messages. Unlike traditional messaging platforms, Airchat encourages users to communicate through short voice clips rather than text. By doing so, the app seeks to foster deeper connections between individuals and reduce reliance on impersonal digital correspondence.

Stay tuned for next week's roundup of technology headlines and insights. Until then, enjoy exploring these stories further and consider subscribing to our newsletter for convenient updates delivered straight to your inbox.
meta_desc: "Explore Elon Musk's X fees, Change Healthcare breach, Tesla price drops & FSD, space startup deals, and Waymo roadblocks - Stay updated!"

post_title: Women in AI: Anna Korhonen studies the intersection between linguistics and AI
title: Anna Korhonen's Pursuit: Responsible & Human-Centered Natural Language Processing
post_content:
Title: Spotlight on Anna Korhonen: Pioneering Responsible Natural Language Processing

Introduction

In an era where AI is rapidly revolutionizing various industries, it's essential to celebrate and recognize the contributions of those who drive this change. Recently, TechCrunch has been highlighting women who are significantly impacting the AI field. Among them is Anna Korhonen, a professor of natural language processing (NLP) at the University of Cambridge and a senior research fellow at Churchill College. She is also a fellow at the Association for Computational Linguistics and the European Laboratory for Learning and Intelligent Systems.

Korhonen's Research and Achievements

Anna Korhonen's fascination with human intelligence and language, coupled with her passion for engineering and computer science, led her to specialize in AI. Her research focuses on NLP, developing, adapting, and applying computational techniques to meet AI's needs. She is particularly interested in responsible and "human-centric" NLP that draws on the understanding of human cognitive, social, and creative intelligence.

Korhonen is proud of her work on natural language processing and the development of tools that support social and global good. Her current research mission involves creating AI that improves human lives, emphasizing the positive potential of AI for social and global welfare. As an educator, she inspires the next generation of AI scientists and leaders to focus on realizing AI's potential.

Overcoming Challenges in the AI Field

Despite the male-dominated nature of the tech and AI industries, Korhonen enjoys working in an area with a significant female population and established support networks. However, she acknowledges the influence of the male-dominated industry on AI's priorities and agenda. She encourages women to actively network and help each other to achieve better gender balance in the field.

Pressing Issues in AI Evolution

As AI evolves at an unprecedented pace, Korhonen emphasizes the need to put human needs and safety at the center of AI development. She encourages addressing pressing issues such as AI's safety, trustworthiness, impact on jobs, democracy, and the environment.

AI User Awareness

Korhonen highlights the importance of understanding AI's limitations. Current AI lacks the world knowledge of humans and the ability to understand complex social

post_title: Notable Capital's Hans Tung on the state of VC and the upside to down rounds
title: Hans Tung Discusses Down Rounds and Fintech Opportunities at Notable Capital
post_content:
Title: Down Rounds and Fintech: A Conversation with Hans Tung, Managing Partner at Notable Capital

Introduction

In the dynamic world of venture capitalism (VC), certain phrases like "down rounds" may send shivers down the spines of many investors. However, Hans Tung, a managing partner at Notable Capital (formerly GGV Capital), views such situations differently. In this article, we delve into Hans' insights on the current state of VC, the significance of down rounds, and his enthusiasm for the fintech sector. We will also touch upon the evolution of Notable Capital and recent trends in the industry.

The State of Venture Capital and Down Rounds

Down rounds, where a company raises funds at a lower valuation than its previous financing round, often carry negative connotations. Nevertheless, Hans Tung remains optimistic about their potential benefits, stating, "An IPO is actually just a milestone, not the end game... When you think in longer-term valuations, up or down temporarily doesn't matter as much as generating a big outcome at the end." This perspective becomes increasingly relevant considering that, based on PitchBook data, approximately 11% of the year's VC deals involved down rounds by September 2023.

Bullish on Fintech

Financial technology (fintech) continues to excite Hans Tung, who sees significant opportunities in various segments of the market. He explains, "[W]hat sectors in the fintech space have me especially psyched? Well, there's embedded finance, open banking, insurtech â€“ basically anything related to financial services getting digitized." With numerous startups disrupting traditional financial institutions, the fintech landscape presents lucrative prospects for both entrepreneurs and investors alike.

Notable Capital's Evolution

GGV Capital recently underwent a significant change, transforming its U.S. and Asian operations into Notable Capital and Granite Asia, respectively. According to Hans, this move reflects the firm's commitment to maintaining strong connections between regions while staying nimble amidst evolving market conditions. Such adaptations mirror other shifts happening across the VC ecosystem, such as personnel alterations at firms like Founders Fund, Benchmark, and Thrive Capital.

Conclusion

Navigating the ever-changing terrain of VC requires visionary leaders capable of identifying unique investment opportunities and embracing alternative strategies like participating in down rounds. By keeping abreast of industry developments and remaining committed to long-term value creation, successful venture capitalists like Hans Tung continue to thrive despite challenges presented by shifting market dynamics. As fintech innovation accelerates, expect further disruptions and exciting growth possibilities across multiple industries.
meta_desc:
Meta Description: Discover Hans Tung's refreshing take on down rounds & fintech innovations. Explore the evolution of Notable Capital, recent VC trends, and seize fintech opportunities with our concise yet informative meta description.
